intro: Corydalis tortisiliqua var. longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bracted corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and delicate, spurred flowers. The leaves are typically lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
